editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Know the rules of poker? Get ready to break them in this brilliant roguelike deck-builder, which puts its own twist on the classic card game.
Swing, batta batta! Cheeky heckling and memorable stars make this remastered classic as fun as we remember.

Ready for something a bit different? Plague Inc. challenges you to strategically spread and evolve diseases. While the concept isn't exactly honorable, the surprising ways all these novel gameplay systems interact make this twist on traditional heroism a lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

editorialNotes.standard: An intriguing genre blend, Terraria mixes collection, construction, and combat in a retro-styled 2D adventure. Break apart the world, uncovering rare treasures and digging deep underground for resources to build elaborate houses. Then craft powerful weapons and armor before facing bizarre, fantastical creatures. It’s a huge, sophisticated experience that’s easy to spend hours with—a universe of densely layered surprises, where every session is exciting.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic light—it’s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstar’s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.
What happens after a zombie apocalypse? Find out by intuitively rebuilding civilization in this slick sequel to Plague Inc.

name: Ticket to Ride® The Board Game

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Created by Ellen DeGeneres, this riotous game-night challenge reinvents charades for the app generation. Pick a category, then hold your device up to your head, screen facing outward, and guess the words using your friends’ clues. Several categories are included, with many more available as In-App Purchases. Best of all, you can record and share videos of your friends’ increasingly frantic efforts to clue you in. Heads Up! puts a fun, fast-paced party starter in your pocket.
Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp lives on! This offline version of the beloved management sim includes all the original content, plus a few new surprises.
Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

editorialNotes.standard: Years after its debut, The Room remains one of the most absorbing puzzlers we’ve played. Use ingenuity and intuitive controls to manipulate a series of nested boxes and unlock the secret inside. As each thrown switch and decrypted code reveals another intricate enigma, breathtaking sights and eerie sounds weave an irresistible atmosphere of suspense. All the more amazing for being the debut effort from Fireproof Games, The Room beautifully blurs the line between entertainment and artistry.

Your starship is outgunned and on the run from a fleet of rebel forces; can you make it home alive? A space-combat experience of remarkable depth, FTL's elegant, interlocking gameplay systems generate moments of remarkable tension and reward. As your vessel leapfrogs between galaxies, you’ll manage a crew, extinguish engine-room fires, target enemy shield generators with energy weapons, and equip powerful upgrades so you can plunge deeper into the uncharted cosmos. It’s a constant cycle of surprise and excitement, augmented by the game’s stylish presentation and irresistible charm.
Talk about a sticky situation! Build structures with all sorts of goo to stretch this long-awaited physics puzzling sequel to new heights.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.
Harvest crops of olives, grapes, and sorghum for the first time in this long-running sim series that lets you really dig into the details of virtual farming.

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains, and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing subways come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

editorialNotes.standard: We loved returning to this bizarre world to fight, craft, and chuckle—and the sequel goes big with new features like handcrafted environments and dodge-rolls.

Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

editorialNotes.standard: We love dropping into this city builder’s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighborhoods of our own creation.

editorialNotes.tagline: From the creator of Plague Inc.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Now here’s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this series—its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles, and beautiful visuals—while making masterful enhancements. It’s no wonder it’s an Honorable Mention for Best Mobile Game at this year’s Game Developers Conference. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.
editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable.

editorialNotes.standard: Use curious elevators to cross beautiful buildings in a puzzler that’s as stylish as it is confounding.
Awesome reaction emoji! Strategy-smashing Nope cards! The fur truly flies in this slick adaptation of the zany card game.

Tap on almost anything in this stellar hidden object game and you might giggle when you realize voice actors supplied almost all the sound effects. Because the game has no time limit, you’re free to relax and fully explore every homespun level and discover all the strange and endearing secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

editorialNotes.standard: When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

A terrific follow-up to our 2012 iPad Game of the Year, The Room Two continues the dark, foreboding tale introduced in its predecessor. Marvelously detailed graphics and eerie music make this first-person puzzler feel stunningly real, and as you travel from an ancient crypt to a séance room and beyond, you’ll love unlocking the secrets of every object—and learning more about your mysterious imprisonment.

Mesmerizing from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.
Looking for good vibes? This heartwarming puzzler delivers again and again as you help a hen rescue her chicks.
Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinci's gadgetry in this escape room puzzle series’ fantastic conclusion.

name: Smart Baby Shapes: Learning games for toddler kids

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a woman’s life.

editorialNotes.tagline: Explore and survive a strange world
editorialNotes.standard: Just from reading the title, you know your objective. But as you explore amazing paper-cutout landscapes, you’ll uncover a weird world dense with secrets and danger. Slick controls make traveling and harvesting food simple, but balancing your hunger and health—and sanity—requires crafting weapons, traps, machines, and more. With tons of mysteries to uncover and challenges to complete, Don’t Starve will keep you enthralled.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
